original_title: Sri Lanka cabinet approves debt restructuring
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s cabinet of ministers had approved a plan to restructure debt, at a special session the President Media office said.
The debt restructure plan presented by the Finance Ministry was unanimously approved by the cabinet, the statement said.
Sri Lanka is seeking to re-structure both domestic and external debt to meet International Monetary Fund debt ceilings on debt sustainability.

8/8 Following the scrutiny by #COPF, the #DDO plan will go into debate in @ParliamentLK this weekend, July 1 & 2. We anticipate a vote to be held to approve the plan, working towards reducing the Debt-to-GDP from 125% to 95% & GFN from 37.5% to 13%. Stay tuned for more info! 📈🇱🇰
The debt plan will be considered by the parliaments Committee on Public Finance.
The plan will go before go before parliament at a special session on July 01. (Colombo/June28/2023)
